intro: Microstylis tenuis, commonly known as the slender-styled microstylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in wet, acidic soils in swampy or marshy habitats. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, with a distinctive, slender style that gives it its scientific name. Microstylis tenuis is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
